info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 03 at 12:06AM EDT until May 03 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Massac County in southern Illinois... Southeastern Pope County in southern Illinois... Southwestern Livingston County in western Kentucky... Central McCracken County in western Kentucky... * Until 1145 PM CDT. * At 1106 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from West Paducah to Lone Oak, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Paducah around 1110 PM CDT. Metropolis around 1115 PM CDT. Brookport around 1125 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Ledbetter. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 1 and 11. Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 35 and 38. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Paducah. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
